body_html:
From a discussion with @netfs -- the REST processing logic will convert base64 -> string bytes.
so if the input is "string" (to represent serialized blob), all you need to do is encode that blob as base64 in the REST request, and the REST api processor will decode that and feed a "string" during inferencing. So, the model graph itself, and hence the serving input receiver, should only ever see a string. Is that not what you are experiencing, @tobegit3hub ?

body:
From a discussion with @netfs -- the REST processing logic will convert base64 -> string bytes. 
so if the input is "string" (to represent serialized blob), all you need to do is encode that blob as base64 in the REST request, and the REST api processor will decode that and feed a "string" during inferencing. So, the model graph itself, and hence the serving input receiver, should only ever see a string. Is that not what you are experiencing, @tobegit3hub ?
